<<<api>>>: Activity.findViewById
<<<code>>>: public class AnimationClass {
    private ImageButton heart_icon, bee_icon;
    private Animation anim_heart, anim_bee;

    public AnimationClass(Activity activity) {
        heart_icon = (ImageButton) activity.findViewById(R.id.heart_icon);
        bee_icon = (ImageButton) activity.findViewById(R.id.bee_icon);
    }

    public void loadAnimations(Activity activity) {
        anim_heart = AnimationUtils.loadAnimation(activity, R.anim.heart_anim);
        heart_icon.startAnimation(anim_heart);
        anim_bee = AnimationUtils.loadAnimation(activity, R.anim.bee_anim);
        bee_icon.startAnimation(anim_bee);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The NullPointerException was likely due to the fact that the findViewById method was being called before the setContentView method in the onCreate method of the MainActivity. This was fixed by passing the Activity instance to the AnimationClass constructor and calling findViewById from there. Also, the static keyword was removed from the ImageButton and Animation variables, as well as the loadAnimations method, because static variables and methods belong to the class itself, not an instance of the class. This could have also been a source of the NullPointerException.
